website_summaries.verdict: Portable and versatile, but quite expensive.
pros: Lightweight and easy to use throughout the house
cons: A few reports of faulty units that fail to produce steam

customer_reviews.title: Love this steam mop!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Shark steam mop-did an awesome job on my tile!!!! I've owned 2 Shark steam mops in the past-loved them, but they quit after using them for about a year. However, I used tap water and Arizona has hard water, so I'm sure it's the minerals that eventually clogged the machine and contributed to it's failure-my fault. In the interim, I used another brand of steam mop, which was far inferior to the job the Shark did. I re-ordered this Shark steam mop after the last brand died, and I'm so impressed...again! Way more steam, bigger water tank, longer cord, and love that you can flip the head over for double cleaning with 1 cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A McKey

customer_reviews.title: Sure a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: I clean the floor every other day, usually on my hands and knees, with scrubs and floor cleaning products thinking it was the best way to get all the dirt out. I have messy kids and definitely have had plenty of dirty shoes walked thru the house. But I have been trying to lean off chemical use in the house and the organic products don't seem to do the trick for me. I saw the review on this product and thought to give it a try. Pretty sure the picture itself says it all!
customer_reviews.author: mommy at home

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: It’s a pain to have to pump the whole time you’re mopping. After 6 months it stopped working (no steam would come out when pumped), I contacted Shark who said no product like this existed. The man who spoke to me couldn’t understand what I was saying and continuously asked me to repeat and spell words I was saying and it was hard to understand him. He said he needed my credit card number to have the unit fixed. I Won’t be buying a Shark product again.
customer_reviews.author: BSprime31

customer_reviews.title: I do not recomment it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Im sure if you had the strength of Hercules, this might be a good steamer mop. It does a decent job cleaning but does not get the floor very wet. The worst thing is how difficult it is to push! Definitely not recommended for anyone with a bad back. Its like pushibg a cinder block with a handle. I would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SHOPPER

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective and effortless
customer_reviews.text: This steam mop is completely underrated. As you can see in my photos, it pulls through on even the toughest, worn in dirt on my textured tile floors. I use it without any other products, which means no chemical odor, no bleached spots, and safe around children and pets after usage. Most spots require no additional scrubbing if allowed to be saturated in the steam for just a few seconds. As for the mop pad, just throw it in the washer, air dry, and voila! No more costly Swiffer mop pads or messy mop buckets. For the price, it is without a doubt the best bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bland

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY JUST TO SAVE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I had the top of the line Shark (can't remember the model number) for 9 years and it finally died (ran but stopped producing steam). I thought this cheaper version would be just as good, so what if I have to pump the handle from time to time? NO WAY. This model is AWFUL. Constantly have to pump the handle for steam and it still leaves my tile floors wet for several minutes. Trying to go to another area and I nearly slip on the water it leaves behind. I've stuck with it for only 4mo now and decided to switch all together to the Bissell mop. Only $50 or so but a COMPLETE waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal G

customer_reviews.title: Buy this it works great !
customer_reviews.text: We mop weekly. We used other products that seem to attract more dirt once you finish mopping it looks clean but there was a film on the floor. As you could see from the photo this is the very first time I’ve used them up and are clean floors are really really still dirty it just looks clean but this is the residue from other mops and other products . I also recommend you to buy the extra mopheads they sell on Amazon to go with this product because you go through a lot of mopheads.
customer_reviews.author: Azura

customer_reviews.title: Very unrealistic way to steam mop. You have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very unrealistic way to steam mop. You have to constantly squeeze the handle to get steam out. I’ll stick with bissel steam mops where the steam is automatically constant.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Works great, is compact, light weight and simple to use. It is somewhat difficult to find the right replacement heads. Even though many companies make them, they have extremely variable performance. The ones with the longer nap, like string mops, are best.
customer_reviews.author: Applewhite MinyardTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Super clean!
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to see grime on my kitchen floor. I have been using the swif*** wipe mop till now, but though I usually went over the floor twice, I wondered if it was getting clean enough. Today, I swept the floor, then used the Swif*** , THEN went back and steam mopped it with the Shark Steam Pocket Mop. I did two passes over the floor (about 12' x 6'), once in each side of the mop. The grime it collected really surprised me. It collected more dirt on the second pass than I expected to see in all. (See photos)
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: Product broke after two uses.
customer_reviews.text: This unit didn't produce much steam the first time I used it. The second time I used it it stopped steaming entirely. I did troubleshooting with the manufacturer and eventually they told me to send it back. I also think it's clumsy and hard to push. For what it's worth, the Shark troubleshooting person was very condescending, so I will not purchase another Shark unit. Going to try something different.
customer_reviews.author: Diane A.

customer_reviews.title: Good mop for a SMALL area
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mop for a SMALL area. We have over 2000 square feet, mostly hardwoods and it takes too much effort with this mop. You have to pump to get it started which isn’t awful but some work compared to other mops I’ve read about. The pad also seems small if you have a large area. In a small kitchen/living area this would be plenty but I’d recommend something bigger if you have a larger area. Compared to an old fashion mop it’s much better but I’m returning and looking at other models.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Cleans good, but hard to push and pull.
customer_reviews.text: I like that it still cleans. However, it is hard to push and pull back and forth, which is how you make it steam. My last shark steam mop also had 3 selections of steam control: dust, mop and scrub. Additionally, the mop head had a scrubber side and a soft side. I wish I could have found it again. This mop cleans but I.will be.looking for something different as I'll just use it in my basement and camper for the occasional cleaning. Its just too hard to push a d pull.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Epperson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product - DANGEROUS & DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: First the thermal fuse blew. Ordered from Amazon and then worked sporadically for a couple of times then would not generate steam. Opened up the cover and steam generator was super hot but no steam. Troubleshooting revealed that the steam generator was badly rusted and plugged the tiny outlet hole. These pictures show when taking the steam generator apart (top and bottom) and the amount of rust inside. Used only distilled water. They should used 316 SS. The material they are using is low grade metal and easily rust after a few use. Happy that it did not explode and cause electrical shock. Don't waste your money. Spend a bit more and get a reliable one.
customer_reviews.author: JT-Rev6

customer_reviews.title: Cord is way too short on newer version of this model
customer_reviews.text: I love the steam mops by shark but I would get the genius model, it has longer cord, no pumping and pads come off with no touch. I ordered this one because it was the same model as the one I previous owned but it’s way different even though photo looks the same, cord is way shorter by several feet making it to where you have to unplug and plug in again elsewhere in the same room and I’m talking bathroom. It goes through water fast, refilling often. Pad head is smaller than previous version too by several inches. Pay a little more and get the shark genius you’ll be happier in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed - It does not even steam
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed - It does not even steam, although it does feel warm. I had one of these for several years and really liked it, which is why I ordered a second one when the first one finally quit heating. Would send it back but the postage would probably be high. What do you suggest?
customer_reviews.author: carol smoots

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment in the purchase of the Shark Steam Mop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Shark Steam Mop and had it for about 10 years and was very pleased with it. I decided to purchase another and this one has only been used 2-3 times and on the 3rd time it will not steam the floors. It sounds like it is going to steam when you first plug it in and then nothing except drips on the floors. So disappointing. I would send it back but I have had it now 2 months. Very disappointed customer.
customer_reviews.author: Holli

customer_reviews.title: Not the Same as the Old Model!
customer_reviews.text: If you had one of the older models (which worked vert well), be aware that this is newer model is different in some fundamental ways. It is quite difficult to push. It does not clean as effectively. The water reservoir is near impossible to fill to capacity due to poor design. It does not have settings for the steam, rather you must MANUALLY pump to get a decent amount of steam. I was under the assumption that it would provide sufficient steam without pumping, but that is not the case at all. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long . . .
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in July 2019, fell in love. Steam occurred quickly and cleaned my hardwood and laminate flooring without chemicals. Cord was not as long as I’d like but it was doable. My dissatisfaction now is after only 20 weeks it stopped working. I live alone and only use this once a week. I’d like to think I just got a lemon, and would like to purchase another but I think I’ll look around first.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I love it just received it on Saturday and so far it works great. I have small kids so I'm constantly cleaning I have dark wood floors so you can see everything on them. And moping just took so much time and left a lot of water it just didn't feel clean. and I can really use chemicals on the floor since I have a 9 month old crawling everywhere I needed something quick to use and safe. I have to say it has cut my time in moping in half I can mop the house in 10 min now. And my floor feel and look clean. I'm so happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great mop; very happy. I was tired of having to buy pads and solution for my swifter wet jet , that I felt never really got my floors very clean. This is easy to assemble and use, comes with two reusable cleaning pads which I’ve already used and they were very dirty but washed up good as new. On very dirty floor areas you’ll have to go back and forth several times for the area to be fully clean,but not really any more difficult to use than a swifter. I like that it’s electric and doesn’t require batteries. My tile and wood floors look amazingly clean. I’m happy all I need is water and not special solution refills.
customer_reviews.author: MrsDiscoStu

customer_reviews.title: Only Good for Sanitizing - Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Preface: I have 3 cats so I mop my floors weekly. I was first thrilled at the ease of use this mop presented after being forced to sanitize my floors from coccidia. Then, a few months later I decided to follow up with a swiffer for extra scent and added cleanlines. I was left a little miffed at how much dirt came off the swiffer in comparison to the mop in an area I just went over thoroughly. For the future, I will only use this for sanitizing and not expect any sort of middle level cleaning. See attached photos.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a new home with a lot of wood flooring and wanted something that would sanitize and clean up the floors. My grandmother recommended this and couldn't be happier! It's simple to operate and and figure out. It doesn't leave any big residue on the floor and the amount of shine after is truly unbelievable. The cord is pretty short and do kind of wish there was an on and off button and the plug wasn't the only want to turn it on, but a small inconvenience for an overall really great product. I've already recommended to many others.
customer_reviews.author: Kalsterk

customer_reviews.title: Easy, convenient
customer_reviews.text: After spending hours researching and comparing steam mops I decided to go with this one and I’m so glad I did. I love how easy it is to use this steam mop and convenient that I don’t have to purchase special cleaning products In order to use it. The handle is adjustable so I don’t have to hunch over to apply pressure like I would with my swiffer. It’s lightweight and allows you to easily flip the pad to the other side. I can’t say enough great things about this steam mop! Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately for us we just had oak sanded and refinished ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately for us we just had oak sanded and refinished, for whatever reason the pads of these pick off splinters of the oak. This thing is kind of hard to push around and I'm not confident at all it's actually cleaning. The entire mop head doesn't seem to fully get wet or come into contact with the floor, just where you're putting pressure, above the base of the handle. I've used this in two different houses on six different kinds of surfaces. Will be selling on craigslist I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia M

customer_reviews.title: Great basic steam mop
customer_reviews.text: I love this steam mop. It has no fancy bells or whistles just very to the point. I love the fact that you can use both sides so you can just flip it over and not have to replace the whole pad if you need to use it again. I also like the large water reservoir tank so you don't have to refill as often. It does take a while to get hot and you do need to go over a spot several times to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had sent this back immediately. Barely steams can do kitchen with the cloth staying mostly dry. I used to have a Haan that worked wonderfully. I bought my kids the green Shark lower model of this one and they liked it. When my Haan quit after 10 years of a lot of use I thought I would get this upgraded Shark because it was on sale from Amazon. It is the worst appliance I have ever bought. I don’t write negative reviews but I must about this.
customer_reviews.author: debi

customer_reviews.title: Mop quit working, customer service was on it.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this, I loved it - wasn't as good at deep cleaning as getting on your hands and knees and "grandma scrubbing the floor", but I wasn't down on the floor, and actually hardly had to touch any water or mop head. Had the mop for about 8 months, didn't use it for a little while, and it quit working. Their customer service had me troubleshoot, and when it still didn't work, sent me a replacement (that was also an upgrade for some reason) for $1.
customer_reviews.author: NME

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hate it ... but I don’t love it, either
customer_reviews.text: This is my first steam mop, and it’s just OK. The water reservoir is very hard to fill — it’s not removeable and cannot be filled in a vertical position, so I have to lay the whole mop in my countertop. Then the rounded shape of the steamer makes it roll around when I’m trying to pour water into a very small opening, which is frustrating. I have hardly used it for this reason. Also, when I use it, it seems a bit dry — takes a lot of pumping to get the steam going, and I have to go over areas multiple times. Pros: Lightweight and easy to use on hardwood
customer_reviews.author: A D

customer_reviews.title: So fresh and so clean!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this mop is to maneuver! It makes my hardwood floor shine like crazy with no harsh chemicals. I will say it doesn't work super well on slate tile tho because of the cracks and grooves that occur naturally in that tile but other than that the only other "complaint" I have is if you have a lot of hard floors the cord does become an issue just because you have to find outlets and such but you really can't beat this mop in price, maneuverability and cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Just stopped working after 4 months and maybe 5 uses.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4 months ago. Didn't use it everyday, used it maybe once a month. Went to use it today and it wouldn't let steam out. I waited the 60 seconds, heard the steam thing once, and then it stopped working. I pumped it for more steam, and nothing. Tried a couple more times, nothing. Checked the different parts, everything looked fine but it wouldn't produce the steam. It was heating the water up, don't know what happened. I'm angry that I spent all that money for something that didn't work that long. I have a small kitchen so I know it didn't get over used at all. I loved it at first but this is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Solved the sticky hardwood floor problem
customer_reviews.text: This steamer was recommended by YT channel vacuum wars. After watching the tests, I decided to give it a try. I am not disappointed at all. After the second steam session, my floors were not sticky anymore. Previously, I've been using the Swiffer spray mop. Very good, thick, and durable cleaning pads (you get 2). My only issue is that I wish the cord was a little longer but nothing that an extension cord can't fix. I definitely recommend this steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best investment!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great daily or weekly clean up tool. It's super easy to use and very effective in cleaning the floors. It's not good for grout so dont bother trying to restore your grout with it!!! I love it. It's like a more powerful easier swifter sweeper. I hate the idea of a traditional mop that just pushes the bacteria around....this mop does not do that! Cleanup is a breeze simply pull off the pad toss it in the washer and store the mop!!! Dont think about it go buy it! You wont be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: natasha smith

customer_reviews.title: The Pump/Push is a Weird Motion
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I am not "in love" with the steam mop is because the action to produce steam is odd and leads to inconsistent results. You have to pump the handle to produce steam, and continue pumping throughout the whole process. Not a very useful mechanic, and makes it seem like more work to actually mop. I was hoping it would function similar to the canister steamers: it would just produce steam the whole time. RECOMMENDATION: Get a steam-mop that actually produces steam without pumping or get a dedicated canister steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Loving it! Wish I discovered this baby sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving it! Our hardwood floor and tile floor look so shiny after just one mop. It’s easy to use and gives me a peace of mind without using harsh chemicals. We have a kitty and a toddler so the floor can get really dirty. This is a lifesaver and I wish I bought it sooner! My in-laws love it too. We lent them ours to deep clean their floor after they had their tile grouts cleaned, and it worked like magic! The only weakness is that the cord is not long enough, but I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisha

customer_reviews.title: worked good for few months and then stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I have wooden flooring in my apartment and always had a difficult time cleaning via Mop. I bought this product and was super excited as it worked perfectly. The steam, heat, and length everything was near perfect. Unfortunately, after using it for a few months ( I used it 2 to 3 times in a month), it stopped working. Steam was inadequate to clean the floor. I was very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Rafique

customer_reviews.title: This makes life so easy!
customer_reviews.text: This steam mop works great. We used to wet mop tile, Bona or swiffer our wood floors, etc and this does it all. It's much easier than all those and does a great job on all the floor surfaces we've used it on. It's light and easy to move around, works fast and cleans very well. I'd definitely recommend it for any type of hard floor you have. The price is also a deal in my opinion!
customer_reviews.author: Birfield85

customer_reviews.title: Throw out your ordinary mop
customer_reviews.text: Deep cleans without the use of soaps/cleaning products. I used a little bottle of purified water and its lasted a long time. Very easy to use and light weight for a large areas without leaving streaks. Unfortunately I had to return the first one and have a replacement delivered. A common problem with these mops is sometimes the tubing is blocked and cant be fixed. If your steam mop is not working in the first 30 minutes or so you'll need to return it and get a replacement. Luckily Amazon is great with their returns, I got a new one the next day no hassle!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deep cleans without after marks and dries quickly - love it!
customer_reviews.text: Before and after video pretty much self explains everything. Keep in my mind, I have 2 adult men and a baby that contributed to this mess. Pros - everything! The steam really deep cleans and removes sticky patches. It’s doesn’t leave any marks after drying and it drys up very quickly. It’s easy to use and very compact. Cons - which is not really a bad thing, but washing the removable/reusable pads will be a pain especially because they are white! I love it and i wish I knew about it earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Khanam

customer_reviews.title: My Floors are Clean!
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this purchase, I had a Bissell Steam Mop and it was...okay. I decided to spend a bit more more on a Shark 🦈 Mop and what a good decision I made! My laminate woods floors are FINALLY clean! With kids and pets, I feel like it’s a constant battle. Now, they look and feel clean when I walk on them. The pad itself is soft and you can flip it while mopping in order to use both sides! I guess the cord could be a little longer but Overall I’m very pleased and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bee 🐝 Pantry

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: We had a sharp steam mop and it burned out...I purchased this thinking this was a newer one it would be better. Well, it wasn't quite like the one we had and we were disappointed. It gets the job done, but the cord isn't that long, it doesn't have as much steam, and it has one standard mop size. We will get another Sharp steam mop, but this one is just too limited.
customer_reviews.author: Onahele

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and easy to use. The left is the dirt on about 1/3 of the floors (used other pads for the rest). The right pad is after I went through the entire floor a second time just to see how well it worked the first time. I'd say it cleaned my floors pretty well and I'm happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: emmykins

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: We are a household with 5 kids, 3 are boys...with dirty cleats. All the rooms but 2 in the home are hardwood/vinyl. I got this because I'm sooooo sick of dirt and dragging out a mop or half-a$$ed swiffer to do a long, tiresome, dirty job. In less than 15 minutes my entire main floor was clean! In less than 20 minutes it was dry! And very little distilled water used to get it done! 1000 sq feet!! I am sold! I can't wait to get the rest of the house done!
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome floor steamer!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Shark Steam Mop!!! Its extremely easy to get set up and going. A little bit of water goes along way. I've been wanting a floor steamer for years and was so happy to find this at an amazingly low price point. With kids, a dog, and cat I love knowing that my floors are not only clean but sanitized especially with everything thats going on recently.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Light

customer_reviews.title: It works good
customer_reviews.text: I got this to try and cut out the use of chemical cleaners in my home. For that purpose it is great. I like that you have the ability to wash the pads so no waste or added expenses are involved. It works great. The only downside is that you have to manually pump the handle to get the steam. It’s not ideal but as you use it the back and forth motion ends up working to pump for you. I just wish it had a button release for the steam as it would be less energy expended. Overall it does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: vee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this mop. It gets hot pretty quick. It says do not add cleaners or detergents. It does not get hard stains out by itself. I do spray Pine-Sol on the floor before as I mop and it works great. As far as the cord goes, anything with a cord gets annoying . I have a 30-ft extension cord I just use with it so I can't complain. It does come with extra mop head and they are very easily washable in the washer and dryer. I think it's a great product with great quality for the price and value.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Garland

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one
customer_reviews.text: I wore out my first one after a few years and then we got luxury vinyl flooring in most of the house, so I wante another one to clean them with. I love it - it's a little bulky to get out and set up and fill with water (the water tank could hold more) and the cord is kind of short so I have an extension cord I use with it but I love my Shark - all my vacuums have been Sharks since they came out - I have 4 indoor cats and a husband in the country - I couldn't live without my Shark! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Murlynne

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts; please contact me.
customer_reviews.text: Really unhappy with the product I purchased. I ordered a open box for cheaper because the description said it was just open box, but literally the 2 cleaning pads the item is supposed to come with did not come. Someone must've taken them out and just returned this thing. Very unhappy and need the pads so can't even use this thing to clean. Please contact me this is not acceptable. Also now that I inspected again... MISSING THE HANDLE are you kidding me? Someone just returned this item and they didnt even check before sending it out to me.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: It’s a must!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my steam mop!! I wish I would have invested in it years ago!! I have laminate and hardwood flooring. I use it on both. It’s super easy to use. Warms up very quickly. The only thing I wish was different is the card. It’s not long enough for me to do each room, but I added a drop cord to it and leave it attached. So it’s not a make or break for me!
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled

customer_reviews.title: REVIEW MUNKIE THE ONE REVIEW YOU WANT TO READ!
customer_reviews.text: Pros Nice and simple. Quick heat up time (<30s) Easy to replace mop heads. Cons None really. RECCOMMENDED ? YES!!!
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to use on my Hardwood Floors
customer_reviews.text: I first tried the steam mop when my boyfriend brought it over for me to use and I fell in love with it right away. For whatever reasons I have the worst textured cheap hardwood floors in my house that show everything. On top of that I have 2 dacschubds that have accidents so I use it quite frequently. Covers are easy to put on and it came with a extra one so that was great. Easy to fill and it heats up very quickly. Just pump and go and when you feel one side is dirty just flip it over and continue! This has made such a huge improvement in my cleaning and making my floors feel more sanitary.
customer_reviews.author: Tina McKillip

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this I like have you can just use water to clean the floor. I am replacing this from another steamer I bought that stopped working. Plus my cat peed on it so it needed to be replaced. I never really used the older one but, then when I was about to give it away. I used it and,it worked great. So Goodwill old one. New one mine all mine. ( We don’t have a cat now, so I shouldn’t have to worry about cat pee). Love it not sure if I will have to replace it but, will buy from seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my steam mop a long time ago. Just now deciding to write my review. I was able to use my mop twice before it quit working. I tried looking on utube to see if there was something that could help with my problem. Unfortunately, without disassembling the whole thing, I was out of luck. Needless to say, I won’t buy another, especially online, where I can’t return within a reasonable amount of time. I would recommend anyone buying, get it from local retailer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Deep clean and great for hardwoods!
customer_reviews.text: I love this steam mop! I heavily debated this purchase, my hardwoods are not sealed. I am OCD about having shiny and clean looking hardwood floors. This mops lets out an adequate amount of steam without leaving a pool of water. It is kind of a pain making sure that you have distilled water, but will prolong the life of the unit. The chord length is long, but could stand to be a bit longer. Otherwise this has been a great product, cleans very well, and you’d be surprised at what your mop head looks like when your done!
customer_reviews.author: Harlen D Greene

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to push on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use on the tile on our kitchen. NOT easy to use on the hardwood. Too hard to push, about popped my shoulder out of socket. Since it was too hard to push felt like I didn't get the clean I wanted. Returned for the Bissell Steam Fresh mop and I like it so much more!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Smallwood

customer_reviews.title: Very nice steam mop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steam mop because I had birds and I couldn't use a Swiffer swift jet mop because of the fumes. This did a good job but if you are needing to clean something sticky or dirty (soiled) area I would not recommend using a steam mop for that kinds of job. And Remember to use distilled water with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: My other steam mop broke and I was very sad that they no longer made my other brand. I tried this and I was very impressed. I really like how the mop swivels around to the other side and you can get several rooms done without changing the pad. I do two bathrooms, kitchen and entry way with one pad. My only complaint is that the steam is not automatic, you have to push up and down on the handle when you want steam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The mop head makes this unusable.  It is like pushing a sticky 10 pound weight
customer_reviews.text: It does heat up easily but try using it to clean your floor! It is impossible to move across the floor, the pad is way too thick, and does not easily push across the floor. The only way to make this work is to wet the pad well before using and even then it is difficult to use. My husband refuses to use it since it is so hard to use, he has gone back to Swiffer. I waited too long to return or I would have returned it after the first use, Save your money, try another model.
customer_reviews.author: joan

customer_reviews.title: Great for regular upkeep!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Shark mop, the first quit after several months of me using tap water it in.....that's a no no. I ordered another because it does a great job of cleaning for regular upkeep. I do not use this for a heavily soiled area-for example, my kitchen was renovated and there was construction dust/dirt everywhere. I used a regular mop several times before, then used my Shark and was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Philicia Pompeo

customer_reviews.title: Best for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love shark products! This was on sale for prime members 55$ my moms went out and i have laminate , hardwood, vinyl, and granite floors threw out my home. It his every one great. Had to go over a few times because of the cleaning product residue but made my house smell fresher from the high traffic of friends and family. Love the natural way of cleaning and heats up quick. The pump action is awesome so i can get harder spills off my floors. My mom has the same floors in her home and this would make a great gift!!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Shark Steam Mop Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: I have laminated cork flooring in the kitchen and hardwood floor in the family room. Both rooms had drips and spills that were a constant clean-up by hand using a moist sponge. I chose the Shark because I have a Shark vacuum cleaner that does a great job. This mop does not disappoint. It is simple to assemble, charge with water, turn on and begin cleaning. It requires above average effort to push and pull but removes an incredible amount of soil along with the drips. My only critique is that I wish the cord were a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: James in LaGrange

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: Used it once, then it stopped steaming. Called customer support, was told "that happens sometimes." Said they'd send a replacement cord, but would cost $20 to ship. Now we have a fancy stick to push cold water around the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I never realized how much muck and dirt was on the floor until I run the mop over the hardwood a few times. The pad is totally black after cleaning a room. Does a great at getting the job done! Would totally buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Payne

customer_reviews.title: love shark products
customer_reviews.text: I love shark products. they dont last as long as I would like. this one I grabbed because my expensive one died and I really didn't want to buy another really expensive one. this is okay for the money. i feel like the pump action has almost a delay, you pump and pump and pump and you don't think it's doing anything then all of a sudden it spits wayyy to much steam with water that hasn't steamed up. sometimes it makes the mop head a little too saturated. all in all though I love shark products but this one isn't a 5 lol.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality. From minimal steam to NONE!
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money. I had a Shark steam mop for several years that worked great until it died suddenly. I have a Shark vacuum that I love. But this steam mop is a piece of crap! I have used it only occasionally on my kitchen floor (as needed between my weekly cleaner). From the beginning, it did not steam very well and required priming and Lots of pumping. I wish I had returned it on Day One. Tried to use today and no steam at all - just a wet mop and a little puddle on the floor. JUNK! Pure JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great mop
customer_reviews.text: I had borrowed this from a friend and was amazed at the amount of dirt that was mopped up. I did the floor twice, the second time did have less dirt. Based on these results, I decided to purchase my own steam mop. I received it and did 2 more cleanings. The floor is now as clean as it was when installed. The cord length is fine for my kitchen. Yes, it needs to be "pumped" to create the steam, but you do that when the mop is pushed forward. Lightweight and easy to use. Like that the pads are washable and it uses water, preferably distilled. Sorry I didn't know it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Cord is super short. And I cleaned with the steam mop then the day after I mopped up a spot where something spilled with my swifter mop, and as you can see in photo, this steam mop didn’t do a thing. I bought it because it had good reviews, but I will definitely be returning this. My swifter mop did a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Primemom

customer_reviews.title: This is not the Shark to Buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because it was a Shark and I love my Shark Vac and the reviews were great. But as you can see by my pictures after cleaning floors including a tile kitchen floor the mop head did not appear to have cleaned much compared to the review pictures. Also, the pictures of my floor shows streaks and film, also after my dog walked across it after drying there was paw prints. I returned this as it is not worth the money or my time I'll continue using my old fashion terry cloth mop head which leaves no streaks or film.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasts....
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself this mop for Christmas, and at first I really liked it. It was easy to use, heated up quickly, and seemed to do a pretty decent job cleaning my tile floor. I had to have the floor free of any crumbs before steaming it, because it didn’t really pick anything up, which was fine, as it still got plenty of dirt off the floors. However, after just a few months of using it (once a week at most) it has completely stopped working. It doesn’t heat up or produce steam anymore. I wish I would have paid a little more and gotten a better quality product that would last more than 2 months (or 8 uses).
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great product from shark you can trust in.
customer_reviews.text: Having two puppies on our stained concrete floor is a pain at times with the accidents that occur overnight during potty training. I have a microfiber mist mop for easy clean up but after a mess or two the microfiber mop just smells and spreads pee smell everywhere. I switched to a large duster and this shark steam mop for clean up. Has been a lifesaver and keeps our floors squeeky clean. Just make sure and protect your investment and use distilled water
customer_reviews.author: Mark Marin II

customer_reviews.title: Steam
customer_reviews.text: This mop is awesome! First the assembly is extremely easy. The water container doesnt come off but it comes with a little spout thing to make it easier to pour into the confainer which was no problem. The best part about this mop is that as you push and pull your mop it activates the steam so as your mopping its pretty much steaming. Not like some of the other ones where you have tonpress a button as you go. Overall this is a really good product that I would recommend to anyone with any floors other than carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Soosoo

customer_reviews.title: Overall I love this for my hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.text: Love this on my hard wood. Only two problems that I have are that the rectangular shape makes it hard to get behind the toilet and into certain corners. Second problem is that it doesn’t clean the grout in my bathrooms very well. The tile it cleans great but the crevices are hard to get and it goes right over them. Overall though I definitely enjoy this.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Mop stopped working and a loud POP sound from the mop!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mop 3 years ago. It got the job done. I probably have only used this mop once every 2 months or so for a space that is probably 300 sq feet. Well today as i was using the mop, the steam stopped. The floor was getting more wet than usual. I stooped over to check how wet my floor was getting and POP. There was some kind of loud POP from the mop. As you can imagine, I threw the mop down and unplugged it. Everything was okay, but I won't be using this mop anymore--not taking any chances. It did a decent job while it lasted.Now I have all these extra pads that are useless!
customer_reviews.author: Thinking Vanity

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 11 months.  Customer service rep asked me to pay for promised free shipping.
customer_reviews.text: My S3501 worked well, but started overheating after 11 months. Warranty suggests free replacement with free shipping. I spoke with customer service rep "Ender" who asked me to return 6 inches of the power cord with free shipping label, but wanted me to pay $20 for shipping of the replacement product. Sounds fishy. Below is an excerpt from the warranty document "VIP Lifetime Service Guarantee" I found here on the Amazon.com product page. When I read this to him, he waived the charge. Return Freight and re-shipment costs (Ground freight only) are shipped prepaid by Euro-Pro Operating LLC for warranty claims that meet the eligibility requirements.
customer_reviews.author: billvo

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I really love that it covers so much surface area while you mop, to cut back on some mop time if you have a larger area to take care of. There are zero buttons to mess around with! You literally fill it with water, plug it in, and the body/stem whatever you want to call it, of the mop, has an option to “pump” it up and down to get more steam from the cleaner. It’s so easy. Works very well! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Emilymmm

customer_reviews.title: MIGHTY LITTLE FLOOR STEAMER
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Shark. Well made, economical - do the job. Yeah, you could pay hundreds more... but why?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Heart

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of shark steam cleaner, this is my 5th one. The nice part is this a compatible with other versions so I was able to use the triangular shape, larger attachment and the carpet steamer as well. It is the most basic version of the steam cleaner. No ON OFF switch. No control over the amount of steam at once. Pumping the handle increase the steam out put. Reminder distilled water only and drain the water container when you are finished.
customer_reviews.author: Goozoo

customer_reviews.title: First one defective. Replacement working fine
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace an older model which had more features. This particular model is very basic. Holds enough water, light weight, and provides enough steam. The first one we received would leak water over night after we used it. So we returned it and they shipped another one which has been working just fine. Suggest that you use it everyday for the first week to make sure you do not have a defective unit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tong

customer_reviews.title: Easy, efficient, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this! My whole 2 br apartment is hardwood floors. This made them so clean and made my apartment feel so fresh! My only complaint is you just use water, there's no scent. I would like lavender or something fresh smelling. I washed my pad with dish soap and let it air dry. Came almost completely clean. This was so easy and efficient. I bought it out of the box for less money and you tubed the how-to. Ordered the extra pads on here. Hope this lasts me forever!
customer_reviews.author: Marley's Mom

customer_reviews.title: A swifter would be a better option than this and less expensive
customer_reviews.text: The cord isn’t very long, I’m constantly finding myself having to unplug it & plug in a different outlet. On top of that, my floors never feel truly clean, there is some dirt on the pad but no more than what a cheaper, non-cord swifter would do. I have steam mopped my floors 3 times this morning and I’m exhausted and I’m still not super happy with the outcome. It would’ve been quicker to just get a good old fashion mop and bucket. We do have 2 dogs and 2 kids, so the steam mop would probably suite someone with less foot traffic on their hard wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary D.

customer_reviews.title: Good safe clean
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a couple times now, and must say that it does a great job on my floors. I have a dog and a baby, so this was a must. It is important to note that it doesn't really pick up long dog hair, so you need to do a good job sweeping first, but after that it really cleans all the caked on mud and/or dirt. It was surprising how much it cleaned. It is a bit of a workout to use, having to pump and scrub, but nothing unmanageable.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Best mop you could ever own
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly easy to use. Wonderful overall product great for any floor type especially hardwood floors. The cord length could be a little bit longer in my opinion but even with the length of the cord it's okay for me because I dont mind unplugging the cord and replugging it back in throughout my house. Deep cleans the floors better than any normal standard mops and kills all of the bacteria and germs as you clean.
customer_reviews.author: Asheley

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my linoleum floors
customer_reviews.text: Just what I need for my linoleum floors. I have a kitchen, eat in , hallway. and 3 bathrooms with linoleum floors. This steamer makes mopping a breeze. Love the pads that come off and throw in the washer. No more squeezing my mop by hand. I live in an older home that has the older linoleum floors, so I don't have to worry about the steamer taking off the shine of the floors. I have no shine anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Harney

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Shark steamer in 9 years (they suddenly quit after about 3 years). They are easy to use and clean very well. This last one lets out more water than the other two. When I called the company they were helpful but I would have to send it to them and pay $20 to ship it back so I'm using it and it does work. Next time I buy one I will get the consumer protection plan. In spite of what I have just written, I do like the steamer and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: WARRANTY IS A JOKE
customer_reviews.text: The mop handle cracked from the neck of the mop. I called because I was still under the 1 year warranty. After 20 mins he finally told me I'd have to pay $40 plus shipping to replace the mop handle myself because it was a "wearable part", which would not be covered. I asked "what are wearable parts"? He said basically anything on the mop itself. So I could pay $20 more for a brand new mop. The warranty is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Fehl

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have ugly linoleum and tile floors in my apartment which hide a lot of dirt. I use this to deep clean them about every 2 weeks. Works SO WELL, and I even add a few drops of essential oils when the mood strikes. Can’t recommend this enough, it makes mopping enjoyable! Also: I can’t speak to the length of the cord because the areas that I mop are small, but it’s a good product and worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Danni

customer_reviews.title: No more wringing the mop!
customer_reviews.text: I always used a regular mop you had to wring out or got on my hands and knees to clean my floors. I was introduced to the Shark by cleaning house for my aunt and thought what a joke to use one of these! I was sold! I love it! I'm picky but I really love my Shark! It does a great job and is easy to use! I got more cleaning pads for it and they are all machine washable. No more achy hands from wringing the mop.
customer_reviews.author: Kittykat

customer_reviews.title: Overall good but!
customer_reviews.text: I love how lightweight this product is! It’s easy to use, plug and go! The pads that come with it are super soft and really pick up the dirt. I need to look into a scrub pad because I have 3 kids and they always leave messes behind... the original cover doesn’t do great on stuck on messes. The cord is super long and love that I can reach a lot of area. I do wish it had an off button so I could take breaks instead of Plugging and plugging back in! The water tank lasts me about two large rooms, which I love. My last steam mop I had to refill every room!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Words can not describe.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I survived for so long without this thing. I have wood vinyl floors that get dirty really fast with my toddler and baby moving around. I was having to get on the floor with a sponge to get off the food my daughter throws on the floor. This steam mop gets it off so easy. It warms up very fast and is smooth on the floor. The reusable pad is awesome and convenient. It also makes me feel good knowing that it sanitizer my floor since my youngest just started crawling and likes to lick the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite thing!
customer_reviews.text: My Momma always said, "Your kitchen isn't clean until you've mopped it at the end of the day". So, I mop my kitchen floor before bed. WOW I can't believe how much dirt this picked up! It didn't get into the corners as much as I would've liked (hence the four stars for versatility), but I can live with that. Granted, I've only had this steam cleaner for about an hour, but yeah, I think I'm in love! I could kick myself for not buying it sooner. If you're on the fence about getting it, take the leap. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Barthlow

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cleaning product. It disenfects while cleaning. I use it on my wood and tile floors. I have dogs who are in and out of the house tracking all sorts of dirt and I’m also a messy cook. The mop works great to clean up what sometimes appears to be big jobs made easy. The cleaning pads easily attach and don’t fall apart in the washing machine. The shark also is small so not heavy and stores away easily in my small closet. I’d recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ehubley

customer_reviews.title: Make certain you use distilled water
customer_reviews.text: this is my second one. I used tap water in the first one and left it sit for some time. When I came back it didn't work any more. Now I have a second one. I use only distilled water and so far it is working.
customer_reviews.author: ThingMaker

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an older shark steam mop when I purchased this one. The older one was awesome, it was easy to switch out pads and you could actually see the steam come out of it. I was disappointed with the new one because it was hard to remove the hot pad to rinse it. I had to really continue to pump it to get good steam and even then I didn't feel like it was really cleaning. I would not recommend this cleaner. I purchased this cleaner because I read the reviews and they were all so good but unfortunately my experience was not as good as those.
customer_reviews.author: Rob suttle

customer_reviews.title: Shark makes a good product
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Shark Steam Pocket Mop. After more than ten years, we literally wore the first one out. This one has a longer cord and holds more water. The only thing I am trying to work out, the plug for the water. When I am using the mop and need to add water, turning/removing the plug is next impossible. I have removed it by lifting it from the side, but I am afraid of eventually breaking the plug. I will do some research. Still an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Like it

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned one of these before. It was “lost” and I just had to replace ASAP. This is a great way for great cleaning that’s for sure! I have a newborn and it makes me feel better about the floors he has to crawl on that’s for sure! I did purchase additional cleaning pads. You can get a deep, sanitized clean with ease! I recommend to anyone who wants an easy way to clean their floors or steam clean a rug. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Sigmon

customer_reviews.title: Fast & Efficient, But Leaves Streaks
customer_reviews.text: Nice for light sanitizing but it can't really "clean" as you're not rinsing the pad constantly to wash away dirt. Steam comes out fast, it's easy to use, but even with a newly washed pad.. you'll still see streaks across your floor. It's not bad... think advanced Swiffer wet-jet, but if I didn't miss the return window, I would send it back and stick to a more traditional mop and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: Sara M

customer_reviews.title: This product is GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not clean anything. I vaccumed hard floors and followed directions. I would have been better off wetting towel with hot water and rubbing it on my floor. This product is GARBAGE. GARBAGE. Does not clean floors or..........probably anything. I am returning this piece of garbage. Literally you could put water on a paper towel and move it around with your foot and get better cleaning, SO disappointed. Shark? YOU OFFICIALLY SUCK. SERIOUSLY. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY. GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.author: animal lover

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled. I have a bad back, a bad shoulder and a bad foot. Mopping is an incredibly painful chore for me usually. This thing has been so nice. It’s easy to assemble and use. It isn’t heavy. It warms up very quick. It leads my floors so nice. Especially when I spray purell multi surface cleaner on it first and then steam over it after it’s sat for a minute. When I use the Purell spray there are no streaks and my floor is super sanitized.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My old steam mop broke and I was devastated. After about a year of dealing with a mop and bucket to clean my kitchen floors (I have a toddler so it needs to be done frequently) I caved and bought this. For the price it does a fantastic job! My old mop did get things a little bit cleaner and a little bit faster but it was definitely way more expensive. For the price this is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I really love using this so much better then regular mopping! Works great. My only issues are that they steam is not steady, you do have to constantly pump the handle for constant steam. The water reservoir could be larger but I am able to get my large kitchen and living room done before I need to refill. Finally the cord length is good size but could be a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Stumf
